text.text_translated: Many managers place a negative comment between two positive ones, and when this becomes routine employees may see the positive feedback as merely sugarcoating, which is the practice of making something seem nicer than it really is and therefore reduces its value. Instead of simply softening the negative comment, positive feedback should be used to encourage good performance.
